General.Desc: This section lists all general kernel settings, mainly for maintaining the kernel.

Keys.Name: Check for Updates on Startup
Keys.Description: Each startup, it will check for updates.

Keys.Name: Custom Startup Banner
Keys.Description: If specified, it will display customized startup banner with placeholder support. You can use {0} for kernel version.

Keys.Name: Change Culture when Switching Languages
Keys.Description: When switching languages, change the month names, calendar, etc.

Keys.Name: Language
Keys.Description: Specifies the kernel language.

Keys.Name: Culture
Keys.Description: Which variant of the current language is being used to change the month names, calendar, etc.?

Keys.Name: Show app information during boot
Keys.Description: Shows brief information about the application on boot.

Keys.Name: Show stage finish times
Keys.Description: Shows how much time did the kernel take to finish a stage.

Keys.Name: Start kernel modifications on boot
Keys.Description: Automatically start the kernel modifications on boot.

Keys.Name: Show current time before login
Keys.Description: Shows the current time, time zone, and date before logging in.

Keys.Name: Notify for any fault during boot
Keys.Description: If there is a minor fault during kernel boot, notifies the user about it.

Keys.Name: Show stack trace on kernel error
Keys.Description: If there is any kernel error, choose whether or not to print the stack trace to the console.

Keys.Name: Automatically download updates
Keys.Description: If there is any update, the kernel will automatically download it.

Keys.Name: Enable event debugging
Keys.Description: Enables debugging for the kernel event system

Keys.Name: Stylish splash screen
Keys.Description: Enables the stylish splash screen on startup. Please note that it will disable argument prompt and test shell pre-boot.

Keys.Name: Splash name
Keys.Description: Splash name from the available splashes implemented in the kernel.

Keys.Name: Banner figlet font
Keys.Description: Write a figlet font that is supported by the Figgle library. Consult the library documentation for more information

Keys.Name: Simulate No APM Mode
Keys.Description: Whether to simulate a situation where there is no APM available. If enabled, it informs the user that it's now safe to turn off the computer upon shutdown.

Keys.Name: Set console background color
Keys.Description: If you want to set the background color to your favorite terminal emulator color, set it to false. Otherwise, Nitrocid KS will set its own background colors.

Keys.Name: Enable color blindness
Keys.Description: If you are color blind or if you want to simulate color blindness, then you can enable it.

Keys.Name: Color blindness deficiency
Keys.Description: The type of color blindness, whether it's protan, deuter, or tritan.

Keys.Name: Color blindness severity
Keys.Description: How severe is the color blindness?

Keys.Name: Beep on shutdown or reboot
Keys.Description: Enables beeping upon shutting down the kernel.

Keys.Name: Delay on shutdown or reboot
Keys.Description: Enables delaying upon shutting down the kernel.

Keys.Name: Enable simple color blindness
Keys.Description: If you want the simulation of color blindness to be simple, enable this. Please note that the formula used in this simulation method may not be accurate.

Keys.Name: Console supports true color
Keys.Description: If you are sure that the console supports true color, or if you want to change your terminal to a terminal that supports true color, change this value.

Keys.Name: Alternative calendar
Keys.Description: The type of alternative calendar.

Keys.Name: Enable alternative calendar
Keys.Description: If you want the logon screen or the date and time viewer to also show the alternative calendar, enable it.

Keys.Name: Set codepage
Keys.Description: Set the language codepage upon switching languages.

Colors.Desc: This section lets you choose what type of color do you want to change.

Keys.Name: Interactive TUI selected pane separator color
Interactive TUI selected pane item foreground color
Interactive TUI selected pane item background color
Interactive TUI pane item foreground color
Interactive TUI pane item background color
Interactive TUI option binding name color

Hardware.Desc: This section changes hardware probe behavior.

Keys.Name: Quiet Probe
Keys.Description: Keep hardware probing messages silent.

Keys.Name: Full Probe
Keys.Description: If true, probes all the hardware; else, will only probe the needed hardware.

Keys.Name: Verbose Probe
Keys.Description: Make hardware probing messages a bit talkative.

Login.Desc: This section represents the login settings. Log out of your account for the changes to take effect.

Keys.Name: Show MOTD on Log-in
Keys.Description: Show Message of the Day before displaying login screen.

Keys.Name: Clear Screen on Log-in
Keys.Description: Clear screen before displaying login screen.

Keys.Name: Host Name
Keys.Description: The kernel host name to communicate with the rest of the computers

Keys.Name: Show available usernames
Keys.Description: Shows available users if enabled.

Keys.Name: MOTD Path
Keys.Description: Which file is the MOTD text file? Write an absolute path to the text file.

Keys.Name: MAL Path
Keys.Description: Which file is the MAL text file? Write an absolute path to the text file.

Keys.Name: Username prompt style
Keys.Description: Write how you want your login prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Password prompt style
Keys.Description: Write how you want your password prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Show MAL on Log-in
Keys.Description: Shows Message of the Day after displaying login screen.

Keys.Name: Include anonymous users
Keys.Description: Includes the anonymous users in the list

Keys.Name: Include disabled users
Keys.Description: Includes the disabled users in the list

Keys.Name: Modern logon
Keys.Description: Whether to use the modern way to present log-on screen or the classic way (write your username)

Keys.Name: MOTD and Headline at the bottom of the modern logon clock
Keys.Description: Whether to show the MOTD and the headline at the bottom or at the top of the clock

Shell.Desc: This section lists the shell settings.

Keys.Name: Simplified Help Command
Keys.Description: Simplified help command for all the shells

Keys.Name: Current Directory
Keys.Description: Sets the shell's current directory. Write an absolute path to any existing directory.

Keys.Name: Lookup Directories
Keys.Description: Group of paths separated by the colon. It works the same as PATH. Write a full path to a folder or a folder name. When you're finished, write "q". Write a minus sign next to the path to remove an existing directory.

Keys.Name: Default choice output type
Keys.Description: Default choice output type

Keys.Name: Set console title on command execution
Keys.Description: Sets console title on command execution.

Filesystem.Desc: This section lists the filesystem settings.

Keys.Name: Filesystem sort mode
Keys.Description: Controls how the files will be sorted.

Keys.Name: Filesystem sort direction
Keys.Description: Controls the direction of filesystem sorting whether it's ascending or descending.

Keys.Name: Show Hidden Files
Keys.Description: Shows hidden files.

Keys.Name: Size parse mode
Keys.Description: If enabled, the kernel will parse the whole folder for its total size. Else, will only parse the surface.

Keys.Name: Show progress on filesystem operations
Keys.Description: Shows what file is being processed during the filesystem operations

Keys.Name: Show file details in list
Keys.Description: Shows the brief file details while listing files

Keys.Name: Suppress unauthorized messages
Keys.Description: Hides the annoying message if the listing function tries to open an unauthorized folder

Keys.Name: Print line numbers on printing file contents
Keys.Description: Makes the "cat" command print the file's line numbers.

Keys.Name: Sort the list
Keys.Description: Sorts the filesystem list professionally.

Keys.Name: Show total size in list
Keys.Description: If enabled, shows the total folder size in list, depending on how to calculate the folder sizes according to the configuration.

Network.Desc: This section lists the network settings, like the FTP shell, the network-related command settings, and the remote debug settings.

Keys.Name: Debug Port
Keys.Description: Write a remote debugger port. It must be numeric, and must not be already used. Otherwise, remote debugger will fail to open the port.

Keys.Name: Download Retry Times
Keys.Description: Write how many times the "get" command should retry failed downloads. It must be numeric.

Keys.Name: Upload Retry Times
Keys.Description: Write how many times the "put" command should retry failed uploads. It must be numeric.

Keys.Name: Show progress bar while downloading or uploading from "get" or "put" command
Keys.Description: If true, it makes "get" or "put" show the progress bar while downloading or uploading.

Keys.Name: Log FTP username
Keys.Description: Whether or not to log FTP username.

Keys.Name: Log FTP IP address
Keys.Description: Whether or not to log FTP IP address.

Keys.Name: Return only first FTP profile
Keys.Description: Pick the first profile only when connecting.

Keys.Name: Show mail message preview
Keys.Description: When listing mail messages, show body preview.

Keys.Name: Record chat to debug log
Keys.Description: Records remote debug chat to debug log.

Keys.Name: Show SSH banner
Keys.Description: Shows the SSH server banner on connection.

Keys.Name: Enable RPC
Keys.Description: Whether or not to enable RPC.

Keys.Name: RPC Port
Keys.Description: Write an RPC port. It must be numeric, and must not be already used. Otherwise, RPC will fail to open the port.

Keys.Name: Show file details in FTP list
Keys.Description: Shows the FTP file details while listing remote directories.

Keys.Name: Username prompt style for FTP
Keys.Description: Write how you want your login prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Password prompt style for FTP
Keys.Description: Write how you want your password prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Use first FTP profile
Keys.Description: Uses the first FTP profile to connect to FTP.

Keys.Name: Add new connections to FTP speed dial
Keys.Description: If enabled, adds a new connection to the FTP speed dial.

Keys.Name: Try to validate secure FTP certificates
Keys.Description: Tries to validate the FTP certificates. Turning it off is not recommended.

Keys.Name: Show FTP MOTD on connection
Keys.Description: Shows the FTP message of the day on login.

Keys.Name: Always accept invalid FTP certificates
Keys.Description: Always accept invalid FTP certificates. Turning it on is not recommended as it may pose security risks.

Keys.Name: Username prompt style for mail
Keys.Description: Write how you want your login prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Password prompt style for mail
Keys.Description: Write how you want your password prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: IMAP prompt style for mail
Keys.Description: Write how you want your IMAP server prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: SMTP prompt style for mail
Keys.Description: Write how you want your SMTP server prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Automatically detect mail server
Keys.Description: Automatically detect the mail server based on the given address.

Keys.Name: Enable mail debug
Keys.Description: Enables mail server debug.

Keys.Name: Notify for new mail messages
Keys.Description: Notifies you for any new mail messages.

Keys.Name: GPG password prompt style for mail
Keys.Description: Write how you want your GPG password prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Send IMAP ping interval
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to send the IMAP ping?

Keys.Name: Send SMTP ping interval
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to send the SMTP ping?

Keys.Name: Mail text format
Keys.Description: Controls how the mail text will be shown.

Keys.Name: Automatically start remote debug on startup
Keys.Description: If you want remote debug to start on boot, enable this.

Keys.Name: Remote debug message format
Keys.Description: Specifies the remote debug message format. {0} for name, {1} for message.

Keys.Name: RSS feed URL prompt style
Keys.Description: Write how you want your RSS feed server prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Auto refresh RSS feed
Keys.Description: Auto refresh RSS feed

Keys.Name: Auto refresh RSS feed interval
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to refresh the RSS feed?

Keys.Name: Show file details in SFTP list
Keys.Description: Shows the SFTP file details while listing remote directories.

Keys.Name: Username prompt style for SFTP
Keys.Description: Write how you want your login prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Add new connections to SFTP speed dial
Keys.Description: If enabled, adds a new connection to the SFTP speed dial.

Keys.Name: Ping timeout
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to wait before declaring timeout?

Keys.Name: Download percentage text
Keys.Description: Write how you want your download percentage text to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed. {0} for downloaded size, {1} for target size, {2} for percentage.

Keys.Name: Upload percentage text
Keys.Description: Write how you want your upload percentage text to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed. {0} for uploaded size, {1} for target size, {2} for percentage.

Keys.Name: Recursive hashing for FTP
Keys.Description: Whether to recursively hash a directory. Please note that not all the FTP servers support that.

Keys.Name: Maximum number of e-mails in one page
Keys.Description: How many e-mail messages to display in one page?

Keys.Name: Show mail transfer progress
Keys.Description: If enabled, the mail shell will show how many bytes transmitted when downloading mail.

Keys.Name: Mail transfer progress
Keys.Description: Write how you want your mail transfer progress style to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed. {0} for transferred size and {1} for total size.

Keys.Name: Mail transfer progress (single)
Keys.Description: Write how you want your mail transfer progress style to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed. {0} for transferred size.

Keys.Name: Show notification for download progress
Keys.Description: Shows the notification showing the download progress.

Keys.Name: Show notification for upload progress
Keys.Description: Shows the notification showing the upload progress.

Keys.Name: RSS feed fetch timeout
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to wait before RSS feed fetch timeout?

Keys.Name: Verify retry attempts for FTP transmission
Keys.Description: How many times to verify the upload and download and retry if the verification fails before the download fails as a whole?

Keys.Name: FTP connection timeout
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to wait before the FTP connection timeout?

Keys.Name: FTP data connection timeout
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to wait before the FTP data connection timeout?

Keys.Name: FTP IP versions
Keys.Description: Choose the version of Internet Protocol that the FTP server supports and that the FTP client uses.

Keys.Name: Notify on remote debug connection error
Keys.Description: If enabled, will use the notification system to notify the host of remote debug connection error. Otherwise, will use the default console writing.

Screensaver.Desc: This section lists the general screensaver settings. For individual screensaver settings, exit Settings and open Screensaver Settings.

Keys.Name: Screensaver
Keys.Description: Which screensaver do you want to lock your screen with?

Keys.Name: Screensaver Timeout in ms
Keys.Description: Write when to launch screensaver after specified milliseconds. It must be numeric.

Keys.Name: Enable screensaver debugging
Keys.Description: Enables debugging for screensavers. Please note that it may quickly fill the debug log and slightly slow the screensaver down, depending on the screensaver used. Only works if kernel debugging is enabled for diagnostic purposes.

Keys.Name: Ask for password after locking
Keys.Description: After locking the screen, ask for password

Drivers.Desc: This section lists the driver settings.

Keys.Name: Current console driver
Keys.Description: Which console driver would you like to use?

Keys.Name: Current random number generator driver
Keys.Description: Which random number generator driver would you like to use?

Keys.Name: Current network driver
Keys.Description: Which network driver would you like to use?

Keys.Name: Current filesystem driver
Keys.Description: Which filesystem driver would you like to use?

Keys.Name: Current encryption driver
Keys.Description: Which encryption driver would you like to use?

Keys.Name: Current regular expression driver
Keys.Description: Which regular expression driver would you like to use?

Misc.Desc: Settings that don't fit in their appropriate sections land here.

Keys.Name: Show Time/Date on Upper Right Corner
Keys.Description: The time and date will be shown in the upper right corner of the screen

Keys.Name: Marquee on startup
Keys.Description: Enables eyecandy on startup

Keys.Name: Long Time and Date
Keys.Description: The time and date will be longer, showing full month names, etc.

Keys.Name: Preferred Unit for Temperature
Keys.Description: Select your preferred unit for temperature (this only applies to the "weather" command)

Keys.Name: Enable text editor autosave
Keys.Description: Turns on or off the text editor autosave feature.

Keys.Name: Text editor autosave interval
Keys.Description: If autosave is enabled, the text file will be saved for each "n" seconds.

Keys.Name: Enable hex editor autosave
Keys.Description: Turns on or off the hex editor autosave feature.

Keys.Name: Hex editor autosave interval
Keys.Description: If autosave is enabled, the text file will be saved for each "n" seconds.

Keys.Name: Wrap list outputs
Keys.Description: Wraps the list outputs if it seems too long for the current console geometry.

Keys.Name: Draw notification border
Keys.Description: Covers the notification with the border.

Keys.Name: Blacklisted mods
Keys.Description: Write the filenames of the mods that will not run on startup. When you're finished, write "q". Write a minus sign next to the path to remove an existing mod.

Keys.Name: Solver minimum number
Keys.Description: What is the minimum number to choose?

Keys.Name: Solver maximum number
Keys.Description: What is the maximum number to choose?

Keys.Name: Solver show input
Keys.Description: Whether to show what's written in the input prompt.

Keys.Name: Upper left corner character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper left corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Upper right corner character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper right corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower left corner character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower left corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower right corner character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower right corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Upper frame character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower frame character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Left frame character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the left frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Right frame character for notification border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the right frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Default difficulty for SpeedPress
Keys.Description: Select your preferred difficulty.

Keys.Name: Keypress timeout for SpeedPress
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to wait for the keypress before the timeout? (In custom difficulty)

Keys.Name: Show latest RSS headline on login
Keys.Description: Each login, it will show the latest RSS headline from the selected headline URL.

Keys.Name: RSS headline URL
Keys.Description: RSS headline URL to be used when showing the latest headline. This is usually your favorite feed.

Keys.Name: Save all events and/or reminders destructively
Keys.Description: If enabled, deletes all events and/or reminders before saving all of them using the calendar command.

Keys.Name: Default JSON formatting for JSON shell
Keys.Description: Selects the default JSON formatting (beautified or minified) for the JSON shell to save.

Keys.Name: Enable Figlet for timer
Keys.Description: If enabled, will use figlet for timer. Please note that it needs a big console screen in order to render the time properly with Figlet enabled.

Keys.Name: Figlet font for timer
Keys.Description: Write a figlet font that is supported by the Figgle library. Consult the library documentation for more information

Keys.Name: Show the commands count on help
Keys.Description: Shows the commands count in the command list, controlled by the three count show switches for different kinds of commands.

Keys.Name: Show the shell commands count on help
Keys.Description: Show the shell commands count on help

Keys.Name: Show the mod commands count on help
Keys.Description: Show the mod commands count on help

Keys.Name: Show the aliases count on help
Keys.Description: Show the aliases count on help

Keys.Name: Password mask character
Keys.Description: A character that masks the password. Leave blank for more security.

Keys.Name: Upper left corner character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper left corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Upper right corner character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper right corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower left corner character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower left corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower right corner character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower right corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Upper frame character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower frame character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Left frame character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the left frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Right frame character for progress bars
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the right frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Input history enabled
Keys.Description: Whether the input history is enabled or not. If enabled, you can access recently typed commands using the up or down arrow keys.

Keys.Name: Use PowerLine for rendering spaceship
Keys.Description: Whether to use PowerLine to render the spaceship or to use the standard greater than character. If you want to use PowerLine with Meteor, you need to install an appropriate font with PowerLine support.

Keys.Name: Meteor game speed
Keys.Description: Specifies the game speed in milliseconds.

Keys.Name: Enable scroll bar in selection
Keys.Description: Enables the scroll bar in selection screens

Keys.Name: Do Not Disturb
Keys.Description: If Do Not Disturb is enabled, all notifications received will be supressed from the display. This means that you won't be able to see any notification to help you focus.

Keys.Name: Upper left corner character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper left corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Upper right corner character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper right corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower left corner character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower left corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower right corner character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower right corner. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Upper frame character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the upper frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Lower frame character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the lower frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Left frame character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the left frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Right frame character for general border
Keys.Description: A character that resembles the right frame. Be sure to only input one character.

Keys.Name: Censor private info on debug logs
Keys.Description: Censor private information that may be printed to the debug logs.

Keys.Name: Display new notifications as asterisks
Keys.Description: Shows all new notifications as asterisks. This option is ignored in notifications with progress bar.

Keys.Name: Use PowerLine for rendering spaceship in ShipDuet
Keys.Description: Whether to use PowerLine to render the spaceship or to use the standard greater than character. If you want to use PowerLine with ShipDuet, you need to install an appropriate font with PowerLine support.

Keys.Name: Game speed in ShipDuet
Keys.Description: Specifies the game speed in milliseconds.

Keys.Name: Lyrics Path
Keys.Description: Sets the path to a folder containing a group of .lrc files. Write an absolute path to any existing directory.

Keys.Name: Show file size in the file manager
Keys.Description: Whether to show the file size in the status.
